description: Mapping of comments to identified issues for Academic Caution and Conditional students

usage_rules.distribution_principle: Each comment must correspond to appropriate identified issue

Mental health.comment: Week 7. Student disclosed high stress levels and lack of sleep. Referred to Wellbeing team and reminded of available mental health support.
Week 7. Missed second assessment. Student contacted and reported feeling overwhelmed. Referred to Academic Support and encouraged to speak with Counsellor.

booked to see a doctor. Week 5. Student contacted for low attendance. Reminded of the importance of attending classes. Week 7. Student contacted for missing submission due date. Referred to Counsellor for check in for wellbeing as the student advised mental health challenges.

Poor time management.comment: Week 6. Student submitted assessment late. Extension not requested in advance. Advised to submit future requests on time and referred to Academic Skills team.
Week 4. Student submitted first assessment late. Offered academic skills support and advised on extension procedures.
Week 5. Low engagement in tutorials. Follow-up email sent with participation expectations and links to recorded sessions.
Week 6. Student reported working long hours. Referred to careers support for managing work–study balance.

Late Enrollment.comment: Week 3. Student enrolled late. Missing foundational content from Weeks 1–2. Provided links to recorded lectures and encouraged to attend tutorials for extra support.
Week 3 late enrolment. Student finding it difficult to catch up on Weeks 1 and 2. Week 4. Student contacted on lecturer referral. Student has been sick on arrival
Week 2. Student did not attend orientation. Contacted via email with essential course info and Moodle access guide. No response yet

Sickness.comment: Week 8. Student re-engaged with tutorials. Submitted outstanding work with approved extension.
Week 5. Student absent from multiple classes. Email sent to check in; student replied citing family issues. Offered flexibility and reminded of support services.

Death in family.comment: Week 5. Student absent from multiple classes. Email sent to check in; student replied citing family issues. Offered flexibility and reminded of support services.
Week 3. First contact made. Student reported internet access issues at home. IT support referral provided.

implementation_notes.selection_strategy: Randomly assign comments from appropriate issue category
implementation_notes.consistency_check: Ensure comment content matches identified issue type
implementation_notes.timeline_realism: Comments should reflect realistic academic calendar progression
implementation_notes.intervention_escalation: Higher severity comments for students with multiple risk factors
